_header: Rejoice rejoice all that here be
_description: First song at the end of the Weavers’ Pageant in the Coventry cycle (6822) — two quatrains, abab

CovArc112.First Lines:
ReIoyce ReIoyce all that here beThe Angell these tythyng hath
                    browght…
CovArc112.Last Lines:
…For he hathe put awey owre careThe seconde persone in
                    trinitye
CovArc112.Editions:
Rastall,  Richard. 
             The Heaven Singing
Music in Early English Religious Drama I
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1996. 
Craig,  Hardin,
                        ed.  
             Two Coventry Corpus Christi Plays.
